fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When using the [Advanced Roadmaps (formerly Portfolio) App|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1212136/advanced-roadmaps-formerly-portfolio?hosting=server&tab=overview], accessing a [shared link of a roadmap plan|https://confluence.atlassian.com/advancedroadmapsserver/sharing-and-exporting-plan-data-960719459.html] while *unauthenticated* in Jira throws an error with a stack trace in the UI instead of a friendly message saying that I should authenticate to Jira.

This issue occurs as well when using the [Advanced Roadmaps for Jira in Confluence|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1221237/advanced-roadmaps-for-jira-in-confluence?hosting=server&tab=overview] macro in a Confluence page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install a vanilla instance of Jira.
  #* This was validated with Jira version 8.5.3.
 # Install [Advanced Roadmaps (formerly Portfolio) App|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1212136/advanced-roadmaps-formerly-portfolio?hosting=server&tab=overview].
  #* This was validated on App version *3.29.1*, *3.29.0* and the issue was introduced on version *3.27.0*.
 # Create a _Scrum software development_ project with sample data.
 # [Create a plan|https://confluence.atlassian.com/advancedroadmapsserver/creating-and-deleting-plans-802170502.html] based on the sample project.
 # [Share the plan|https://confluence.atlassian.com/advancedroadmapsserver/sharing-and-exporting-plan-data-960719459.html] and copy the generated URL.
 # Open an incognito window (to ensure you are not authenticated to Jira) and access the plan shared URL.

h3. Expected Results
The roadmap plan should not load and there should be a friendly message in the UI to login to Jira so I can see the page -- or the user is redirected to the login page.

If using the regular share link, then user is redirected to the Jira authentication page.
If using the embedded or Confluence links, then the user gets a friendly page to authenticate.

h3. Actual Results
If using the embedded or Confluence links, then the user is presented to an error with the following stack trace.
Directly pasting the URL in the Confluence macro configuration presents the same problem.
{code}
An error occurred whilst rendering this message. Please contact the administrators, and inform them of this bug. Details: ------- org.apache.velocity.exception.ParseErrorException: Encountered "#else\n"
 at com.atlassian.jpo:jpo-ww1//views/page-login-headerless/view.vm[line 7, column 79] Was expecting one of: <EOF> "(" ... <RPAREN> ... <ESCAPE_DIRECTIVE> ... <SET_DIRECTIVE> ... "##" ... "\\\\" ... "\\" ... <TEXT> ... "*#" ... "*#" ... <STRING_LITERAL> ... <IF_DIRECTIVE> ... <STOP_DIRECTIVE> ... <INTEGER_LITERAL> ... <FLOATING_POINT_LITERAL> ... <WORD> ... <BRACKETED_WORD> ... <IDENTIFIER> ... <DOT> ... "{" ... "}" ...
 at org.apache.velocity.Template.process(Template.java:141)
 at org.apache.velocity.runtime.resource.ResourceManagerImpl.loadResource(ResourceManagerImpl.java:446)
 at org.apache.velocity.runtime.resource.ResourceManagerImpl.getResource(ResourceManagerImpl.java:354)
 at org.apache.velocity.runtime.RuntimeInstance.getTemplate(RuntimeInstance.java:1399)
 at org.apache.velocity.app.VelocityEngine.mergeTemplate(VelocityEngine.java:370)
 at com.atlassian.velocity.DefaultVelocityManager.writeEncodedBodyImpl(DefaultVelocityManager.java:117)
 at com.atlassian.velocity.DefaultVelocityManager.writeEncodedBody(DefaultVelocityManager.java:97)
 at com.atlassian.jira.template.velocity.DefaultVelocityTemplatingEngine$DefaultRenderRequest.toWriterImpl(DefaultVelocityTemplatingEngine.java:122)
 at com.atlassian.jira.template.velocity.DefaultVelocityTemplatingEngine$DefaultRenderRequest.asHtml(DefaultVelocityTemplatingEngine.java:113)
 at com.atlassian.jira.web.dispatcher.JiraVelocityViewDispatcher.dispatch(JiraVelocityViewDispatcher.java:51)
 at com.atlassian.jira.web.dispatcher.JiraWebworkViewDispatcher.dispatchViaVelocityView(JiraWebworkViewDispatcher.java:89)
 at com.atlassian.jira.web.dispatcher.JiraWebworkViewDispatcher.dispatchView(JiraWebworkViewDispatcher.java:56)
 at com.atlassian.jira.web.dispatcher.JiraWebworkActionDispatcher.service(JiraWebworkActionDispatcher.java:178)
 at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:741)
{code}
\\
\\
Using the regular share link still properly redirects the user to the authentication page.


h3. Workaround
_Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior on the latest app version. A workaround will be added here when available._
If you can afford downgrading _Advanced Roadmaps_ to version *3.26.0* it would restore this functionality.
fields.summary: Advanced Roadmaps for Jira in Confluence
Selecting a scope of >5000 issues for a plan does not block from creation if the exceeding number is collapsed

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, if users select only "To Do" & "In Progress" statuses and exclude "Done" statuses, Roadmap plan will still show completed sub-task associated to incomplete issues in the Roadmap plan.

+Steps to reproduce+

* Create a Story with couple of subtasks.
* Ensure both of the subtasks are transitioned to the "Done" status.
* Create a Roadmap which includes the Story above.
* From the plan, click on "Filters" and exclude "Done" statuses.


h3. Suggested Solution

Give option in Roadmap plan to hide subtasks in "Done" category 
statuses.

h3. Workaround 

None.
fields.summary: Hide completed sub-task when all "Done" statuses are not selected

fields.description:
As a Product Manager

I want to add Milestones to my Roadmap

So that I can visually communicate significant dates on my roadmap to stakeholders

 

*Acceptance Criteria*
 # User can create milestone(s) against a roadmap.
 # User can give the milestone a name and description(and specify a date)
 # Milestones should appear as lines on the chart (similar to the way current date works).
 # The user can drag the milestone to different dates.
 # The user should see the name of a milestone is on the roadmap view.
 # User can add and remove milestones from the view using the filters above the main chart.
 # A user can select a milestone to edit or delete it.
fields.summary: Milestones for Roadmaps (Server)

fields.description:
+*Business Need:*+

Dependency management view is not giving very good insights. 
 * Very limited filter options.  Missing filters such as a view of current or next sprint (blocked or blocking in current or next sprint). 
 * No counts (ex: total number of dependent issues; total number of dependent issues by dependent team – similar to the heatmap view we created for the Portfolio areas to count # of Sub-Initiatives; etc). 
 * Grouping by team helps a little bit. The navigation is pretty horrible (can’t scroll up or down as scrolling zooms). 
 * What do the colors mean for the lines?  Would be nice if there was a way to commit to a request dependency date OR based on sprint boundaries and then visually see if that dependency will be met or not.

+*Value Statement:*+

As a Product Owner, I want to view the dependencies between issues (both internal and external) by each sprint, release or project so that I can identify the blockers, prioritize issues accordingly and plan for sprints, releases and PI efficiently.

 

+*Acceptance Criteria:*+

Ability to filter dependencies by sprint, release or PI

Ability to view dependencies map/links within the roadmap view

Ability to view issues by sprint or release and then turn on dependencies view to highlight only the dependent and required issues.

Ability to control and assign the required item first prior to dependent item
fields.summary: Improve dependency map to display by sprints, releases or projects

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, if a Parent issue is linked to a child issue via Advanced Roadmap hierarchy, these changes will not be logged in the parent issue's historical entries. Similar behaviour happens when child issue is disassociated with the parent issue where the operation is not logged in parent issue's history entries.


h3. Suggested Solution

Log add/removal action of child issues in parent issue.


h3. Workaround 

None
fields.summary: Log Portfolio child changes related historical entries in parent issue

fields.description: We'd like to create plan views including fields like description or acceptance criteria so we can see more information along with the timelines.  These are Multi-line text fields and are not currently supported.  Please add support for them to be added as custom fields.
fields.summary: Multi-line Text field support for plans

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When typing in the Parent Link field on the issue view screen, the autocomplete will show you suggestions only if you typed a complete word, or a full issue key. If you only typed a few characters, no autosuggestions shown. This is misleading to users who might think there is no parent available.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Have a parent task with the subject "Object 1" available and key PROJ-12. Try to have this parent come up in Parent Link dropdown in the issue view by typing "O" or "Ob" or "Obj".

h3. Expected Results

Parents come up as soon as you start typing, so if you typed "Obj", you will get PROJ-12 coming up as a parent.

h3. Actual Results

If you type "Obj" or "PRO" no autocomplete suggestions are shown. If you type "Object" or "PROJ-12", then the parent comes up as a suggestion.

h3. Workaround

Use full words or full issue key to link to a parent.
fields.summary: Parent Link field autocomplete only works for a full issue key or full words

fields.description:
Currently both AR (cloud and server) does not allow me to add more than one release in CPR plan.

 

I have created Project X which should have 2 release and I added this project in CPR but when adding Project X I am only allowed to select 1 release - I want to add more than 1 release and AR does not allow me to do it.
fields.summary: Cross Project Release - should allow me to add more than 1 release per project

fields.description:
As a Project manager, I want to see dependencies to issues from other linked Jira instances on the Plan.

 
Steps to reproduce:
# Link two Jira applications through Application Links
# Configure the Dependency on Advanced Roadmaps
# Link issue A1 to A2 from the same Jira and to issue B1 from the linked Jira instance
# The plan will only show 1 dependency: from the same Jira instance
fields.summary: Allow dependencies between linked Jira instances (federation)

fields.description:
h3. Problem

When creating Plans, we have to select the releases to be included.

The problem is that when we choose *Select all*, it doesn't include releases created afterward.
h3. Suggested Solution

Include an option to skip the release filter, and include all issues in the boards selected previously.
h3. Workaround

Add a default release, to be added to all issues, and include this release in the plan.
fields.summary: Include option to bypass the Release filter in a Plan

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Some users would like to get a Gantt view per release. The difference with the current view is that there is no need to expand the issues from the Release Grouping.


h3. Suggested Solution

Allow plan to display timeline as shown in the screenshot below:

 !Plan.jpg|thumbnail! 


h3. Workaround 

None
fields.summary: Release Gantt view in Roadmap

fields.description:
Currently, the "View Plans" screen located at /secure/PortfolioPortfolioManage.jspa displays a list of plans grouped by by program. 

This page will not scale well for large customers with 10s, 100s, or 1000s of plans and impacts the ability for a user to find the plan they're looking for. 

Please provide a better way for users to navigate, search, and find plans they're looking for when they go the the "View Plans" page. Adding more columns as metadata for each plan, a search bar that searches the this metadata, and filter/search options for the metadata would meet the minimum need.
fields.summary: Improve ability to find and navigate to plans from "View Plans" screen

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The Bulk edit limit is not being respected and it's throwing an error when editing more than 1000 tickets

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to a Roadmap
# Select more than 1000 tickets
# Click on *Bulk actions > Bulk change in Jira*
# This will throw a *414 request-URI Too Large*

h3. Expected Results
The bulk action should be executed

h3. Actual Results
We're getting an error when editing more than 1000 tickets

h3. Workaround

Edit less than 1000 tickets at once
fields.summary: The Bulk edit limit is not being respected and it's throwing an error when editing more than 1000 tickets

fields.description: Currently, we only have REST api documentation for 2.x version of Advanced Roadmap and not for 3.x version. We need similar documentation for the 3.x release as well : [https://docs.atlassian.com/portfolio-for-jira-server/REST/2.12.0/].
fields.summary: Provide REST api documentation for 3.x release

fields.description:
Currently, the Plan will show Capacity Overload in the form of a red vertical line, as you would see here in the documentation regarding single Plans: 

[Managing capacity|https://confluence.atlassian.com/advancedroadmapsserver/managing-capacity-974360316.html]
 * [Displaying capacity in a plan|https://confluence.atlassian.com/advancedroadmapsserver/displaying-capacity-in-a-plan-974360323.html]

!https://confluence.atlassian.com/advancedroadmapsserver/files/974360323/1005801535/1/1591673467505/edit-sprint-capacity.png|width=231,height=158!

Users would like to see this same information conveyed while in the Program view to know at-a-glance when there are Capacity issues.
fields.summary: Show Capacity Overload within Programs.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When managing shared teams, only up to 50 results are shown at a time. There is no way to show more results. If there are too many teams with similar names, users may not be able to find their team.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Generate many shared teams with similar names
** For example, in my case, I generated 100 teams starting with the letter "c", like c1234, cabd, etc.
# Rename a group to the single letter "c"
# Now attempt to search for the "c" team

h3. Expected Results
* Exact matches are prioritized and shown
* There is an option to show more results if the initial displayed results do not match

h3. Actual Results
* There are limited results show, in what looks to be a random order (maybe this is by internal ID)
* User is unable to find the team they want.


h3. Workaround
User REST api to search for the teams and increase the maxResult limit to a higher value:
{code}
curl -u admin:admin -X POST --data '{query: "c",maxResults: 1000}' -H "Content-Type: application/json" 'http://localhost:8080/jira851/rest/teams/1.0/teams/find'
{code}

To avoid the problem in the future, update the team to something more unique:
{code}
curl -u admin:admin -X POST --data '{title: "c123456"}' -H "Content-Type: application/json" 'http://localhost:8080/jira851/rest/teams/1.0/teams/4/update'
{code}
fields.summary: Unable to Properly Filter Shared Teams when there are too many Results

fields.description: Independent ranking between plans where in one plan rank does not impact the others plan using the same initiative.
fields.summary: Independent ranking between plans

fields.description:
As part of our planning, we would like to have all the stories selected, even if they are already in a resolved status, on our plan view.
However, when creating the plan, the stories already resolved are not presented at the scope step and they can not be selected. 
As a consequence, we can not see all the done/ongoing work related to that Epic. Only stories closed after the plan created are represented. 

At the scope step, it would be great if there is an option (like a checkbox) to list or not the resolved issues for selections.
fields.summary: As a Project Admin, I would like to be able to select also closed stories at the initial scope when creating a plan
Creating and deleting plans documentation improvement

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Pressing number "5" at the keyboard Numpad does nothing
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to a plan
 # Click on *Cog Icon > Configure*
 # Navigate to *Issue sources*
 # Under the *Completed issues* field, erase the current value and try to insert *5* (using the keyboard Numpad)

h3. Expected Results

The field should be filled in with value 5
h3. Actual Results

There is no data change in the field.
 (!) This is not affecting other numbers even though trying to replicate using the keyboard Numpad
h3. Workaround

Use the regular numbers and not the Numpad
fields.summary: Pressing number "5" at the keyboard numpad does nothing

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently whenever a Plan is created on Advanced Roadmaps (formerly Portfolio), no information is recorded about who created the Plan, and when it was created.

h3. Suggested Solution

It would be useful for administrators to have this information on Jira's Audit logs, as it already happens for Boards and Dashboards.
fields.summary: Include Advanced Roadmaps (formerly Portfolio) data on Jira's Audit logs

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

For plans with large number of Sprints, users will have to manually check Sprints one by one to check the Sprint capacity. Users would like a quick way to find capacity of all Sprints from the Roadmap plan.


h3. Suggested Solution

# Add some type of report like page which shows all the Sprints and it's capacity.
# Display the total capacity of the Sprint in the Roadmap view:
 !Screenshot 2020-07-06 at 10.30.09 PM.png|thumbnail! 

(i) Also, make the Sprint capacity editable. 


h3. Workaround 

View/Edit Sprint capacity by clicking each Sprint from Roadmap view.
fields.summary: Display Sprint capacity of all Sprint in plan

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

[https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Advanced-Roadmaps-questions/Portfolio-team-velocity-triggers-quot-Unknown-exception-quot/qaq-p/1410715]

If you click on velocity in teams tab it will crash. They can still set velocity but the forecast thing spins forever and wont show. so its still kind of usable.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # open jpos 2.0
 # go to teams tab
 # on a team click the velocity to open the flyout
 # Error comes up

h3. Expected Results

Not to error
h3. Actual Results

!image-2020-07-06-10-39-51-715.png!
h3. Workaround

No work around
fields.summary: Opening velocity in teams tab in 2.0 will crash it

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, if users clicked on Sprint detail from a plan, they will see following information:

 !Screenshot 2020-07-03 at 7.42.44 PM.png|thumbnail! 

The Sprint duration does not contain year. This might cause some inconvenience for plan which has large number of Sprint.


h3. Suggested Solution

Display date besides the Sprint duration shown in Sprint detail.


h3. Workaround 

None
fields.summary: Display year of Sprint duration in Advanced Roadmap plan

fields.description: Currently, if I'm in a plan and utilize the rollup feature, I have to make sure to actually add the target and end dates (if that's what I'm using to schedule) in order to see these issues scheduled in a program. It would be neat if a program would attempt to auto-schedule based off rollups from lower hierarchy issues that would reflect in the Plan.
fields.summary: Allow Programs in the new interface the ability to schedule based off roll up values

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using Advanced Roadmap's old user experience, if a team has a user and you try to view the "Forecasted Velocity", Roadmap will fail to render the "Forecasted Velocity".

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a plan.
# Ensure that older experience is enabled.
# Click on *Team*.
# Add a user to the team on the plan.
# Click on the Velocity points.

h3. Expected Results

Roadmap renders the "Forecasted Velocity".

h3. Actual Results

Forecasted Velocity fails to be rendered an error is thrown from UI and also from atlassian-jira.log:

fields.description:
h4. Summary
Advanced Roadmaps (formerly Portfolio for Jira) long running thread on *getRelevantCustomFieldIds()* due to inefficient query causing Performance.

h4. Details
Custom fields are loaded when a plan is being loaded. The query will retrieve a list of plan IDs (from AO_D9132D_PLAN) and then for each plan ID another query runs against AO_D9132D_PLAN_CUSTOM_FIELD to retrieve a list of the custom fields linked to that plan. When there are a large number of existing plans, it is slow to load custom fields for all plans. 

h4. Workaround
_Not available at the moment_
fields.summary: Performance improvement for loading custom fields of plans

fields.description:
Currently, a malformatted Announcement banner can break Advanced Roadmap/Portfolio's view:

[Portfolio Plans not showing issues when an Announcement Banner is present in Jira|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/portfolio-plans-not-showing-issues-when-an-announcement-banner-is-present-in-jira-1004940115.html]

This is request is to ask for a version where a malformatted tag does not impact the views, as it does not impact any other Jira page for example. JPO should have the ability to "ignore" malformatted announcement banners.
h3. Logging error message

In addition, there is no logging/error message when a malformatted banner breaks up a view, making the investigation harder and counter-intuitive. We should have an error message in the logs or web inspector to help trace the issue back to banners.
fields.summary: Ignore malformed Announcement banners in Portfolio

fields.description:
Currently, we have only the below operators available while searching for parent link:

  !image-2020-06-18-20-56-06-059.png!

A JQL query where the parent link is not that 1 specific link does not return any result.

for example:
 Parent Link" != <PARENT ID> does not return any result.

So, the ask is to have the negative operator added in the JQL search for parent link
fields.summary: Include a not (!=) operator for 'parent link' while searching issues

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Issue Creation from within the JIRA portfolio plan fails if you have a required field configured in the create transition of the workflow. Please note that *if we disable the improved planning interface*, the same set up works fine.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Install JSU plugin just to add a required field validator. We can follow the below steps
 - Edit the workflow which is associated to the specific issuetype
 - Click on the Create transition, and click on Validators
 - Click on add validator
 - Select the radio button "Fields Required (JSU)" and click add
 - From the available fields, select Description and click "Add"
 - Publish the workflow

1. Open an existing Portfolio plan
 2. Click on Create Issue link from the plan
 3. Provide the summary and select the Issue type as Story
 4. Click on Review Changes button to view the modified details
 5. Click on "Save Selected Changes in Jira" button
 6. Changes cannot be saved' notification is displayed to the user.
h3. Expected Results

It will bring another dialog box requesting for other mandatory fields to fill in according to the issue type selected.
h3. Actual Results

Error as seen in the screenshot

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If a user edits an issue (either with the edit button or bulk update) to update the issue type of an issue, Roadmap does not automatically disassociate the issue from existing parent issue even if it does not match the Roadmap hierarchy configuration.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a hierarchy such as : L1 (Level 1 issue), L2 (Level 2 issue), L3 (Epic),...
# Create an issue with Level 1 issue type.
# Create 2 issues with Level 2 issue type.
# Create 2 issues with Epic issue type.
# Access the Roadmap plan which shows the issues.
# Move the newly created Level 2 issues as child issue of Level 1 issue.
# Move each of newly created Epic issues as child issue of Level 2 issues.
# Review and publish the changes from plan.
# Open one of the Level 2 issue in an issue view.
# Edit the issue type of the Level 2 issue to Level 1 issue.
# Access the plan again and we will see the Level 1 issue has an Epic issue as child issue which does not follow the Roadmap hierarchy.

Screen recording: [^JPO-4277.webm] 

h3. Expected Results

* Roadmap automatically disassociate the child issue of the parent issue if the configuration is against the Roadmap's hierarchy configuration.

h3. Actual Results

* Child issue remains to be associated with the parent issue even though it's against the Roadmap's hierarchy configuration.

h3. Workaround

# Expose "Parent Link" custom field by following steps [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/advancedroadmapsserver/showing-advanced-roadmaps-custom-fields-in-jira-857058481.html] and manually remove the invalid child issues from the parent issue.
# Dissociate the child issue from invalid parent issue from the Roadmap plan. Users can drag and drop the issue affected the issue from the plan.
fields.summary: Editing issue type breaks Roadmap hierarchy

fields.description:
Hi Team, 

Currently, we do not have a way to sort the issues in plan by issue summary or issue number

 

Customer would like to have the feature to sort the issues by issue summary or issue number
fields.summary: Have an ability to sort the issues in the plan by issue summary or issue number

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, if user exported issues from Roadmap plan by following steps in [Exporting reports to CSV|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfolioserver/exporting-reports-to-csv-829825445.html], all the fields configured for the plan will be exported.

Users would like an option to be able to export specific fields while exporting plan report.


h3. Suggested Solution

Add an option in the plan report to allow user export issues with the fields visible on the plan.


h3. Workaround 

Manually delete the column of the field which is not required.
fields.summary: Allow users to configure fields exported

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Portfolio Plan includes issues without releases into the Plan causing it to hit the maximum issue limit. 

This is critical because in a scenario where the user has multiple boards (more than 10) are being used as issue sources. While they have chosen only certain releases to be included (total issue number is about 300+), the Portfolio added the rest of the issue with no release (over 600,000+ issues) causing the Plan to be unusable. 

It is not possible to use a filter instead as that will cause the Target Start and Target End to not able to generate automatically from the Sprint dates. 

(!) So the message here is not exactly what the Portfolio is doing: 
!Screenshot 2020-06-10 at 4.55.05 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create two Scrum project with different boards. 
# Add three issues to each of the projects via the board. 
# Edit two of the three issues with the release: *+AAA+* in their *_Fix Version(s)_* field. 
 !Screenshot 2020-06-10 at 4.49.56 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screenshot 2020-06-10 at 4.49.42 PM.png|thumbnail! 
# Create a new Plan and includes the two boards. 
# Untick all the releases. 
 !Screenshot 2020-06-10 at 4.48.51 PM.png|thumbnail! 
# You will notice that the issues without release are included. 
 !Screenshot 2020-06-10 at 4.49.06 PM.png|thumbnail! 

(i) *Note:* If the issue number exceeds the Plan limit which is 5000, Portfolio will simply give an error and block you from proceeding further. 

h3. Expected Results

No issues will be included. 

h3. Actual Results

Issues with no release get included. 

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Portfolio includes issues without releases into the Plan causing it to hit the maximum issue limit

fields.description:

h3. Actual Results

fields.description:

h3. Actual Results

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If an exception is raised during evaluation of the Plan's JQL, the ARJ interface will fail to display, giving the global _Sorry, we had some technical problems during your last operation._ error page

!image-2020-06-03-09-59-53-699.png|thumbnail!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On Jira 8.5.3, Install Script Runner 6.0.2-p5
 # Create a Filter with a Scripted JQL Function, eg {{issueFunction in linkedissuesofAllRecursive("", "is Epic of")}}
 # Create some issues, so that the filter would return at least 1 issue
 # Create a Plan, with Issue Source as the filter
 # Disable the Scripted JQL Function used in the filter, eg linkedissuesofAllRecursive in Manage Apps -> Script Runner -> Modules
 # Try to load the Plan

h3. Expected Results

The problem is handled more gracefully, like Agile Board, or even JPOS' own Issue Sources page:
 !Screen Shot 2020-06-02 at 4.38.24 pm.png|thumbnail!

Agile Board:
 !Screen Shot 2020-06-02 at 4.48.51 pm.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

The interface fails to load at all. 
 !Screen Shot 2020-06-03 at 9.57.57 am.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Resolve the problem causing the exception
fields.summary: If an exception is raised during evaluation of the Plan's JQL, the Plan will fail to display

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Portfolio Plan view scroll bar is not showing up
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to the Portfolio Plan view
 # The scroll bar is not appearing

h3. Expected Results
 * The scroll bar is appearing, able the user to scroll down the page with the bar.

h3. Actual Results
 * The scroll bar is not appearing to scroll down the plan view page with the bar.
* It is showing up in the Portfolio *3.18* or newer version.

h3. Workaround

* To scroll down the page, it needs to use the Mouse scroll or Keyboard arrows.
* Upgrade the Portfolio to *3.18* or newer version.
fields.summary: Portfolio Plan view scroll bar is not showing up

fields.description: It is not possible to Filter the *Portfolio Plan view* by *text custom fields*. This would be great to filter by this kind of field, as there is the possibility to add *text custom fields* to the *Plan view* and for instances, with lots of issues, it would be easier to manage.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you have any Advanced Roadmaps plan page opened on the browser, then click on Help (? symbol which is to the left of the settings (gear symbol) and click on About JIRA. The dialog box that opens, is distorted.

However, if you are out of the Advanced Roadmaps plan page and then click on Help (? symbol which is to the left of the settings (gear symbol) and click on About JIRA. The dialog box works fine. the size and width of the box is of the original size.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Open a plan in *Advanced Roadmaps for Jira Server*

 * Head on to the Jira Software navigation bar and click on the !https://pf-emoji-service--cdn.us-east-1.staging.public.atl-paas.net/atlassian/question_mark_64.png|width=20,height=20! icon

 * Click on *About Jira*

h3. Expected Results

The About JIRA window dialog should be rendered fine (see screenshot below).
h3. Actual Results

The About JIRA window dialog looks cramped (see screenshot below).
h3. Workaround

Open the About Jira page from somewhere outside of Advanced Roadmaps
fields.summary: "About Jira" under HELP section (? symbol) gets distorted if Advanced Roadmaps plan page is opened

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Customers would like to see an option that prevents Portfolio from automatically bringing in newly created releases that did not exist when the Plan was created.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Plan with a single release selected.
 # Create a new release in a connected Project.
 # Reload the Plan, and see that any issues assigned to that release appear, as well as this new release appears in the Releases tab.

h3. Expected Results
This would not be available in the Plan until selected in issue source configuration.

h3. Actual Results
New release is automatically added to the Plan.


h3. Workaround

Required, if there is no workaround please state:
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Create option to disable the Plan from bringing in newly created releases that were not available at the time of Plan creation.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When using the new Export a plan to CSV feature [released in 3.23|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfolio/portfolio-for-jira-3-23-release-notes-998639939.html#PortfolioforJira3.23releasenotes-export-plan-to-csv] and detailed in the ["Sharing and exporting plan data"|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfolioserver/sharing-and-exporting-plan-data-998886665.html] documentation,  all the plan data except for dependencies are exported leaving off a critical portion of the information.

h3. Environment
* Portfolio versions 3.23 and later
* Affects New planning interface, and does not apply to live plans

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add the Dependencies [column|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfolioserver/displaying-issue-details-962968232.html] to a plan
# Add a [custom field|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfolioserver/custom-fields-967895171.html] as a column to the plan as well for a referance
# [Export the plan|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfolioserver/sharing-and-exporting-plan-data-998886665.html] by selecting *Export > Spreadsheet (.csv)*
# Open the CSV to review the data

h3. Expected Results
Dependencies inward and outward links are detailed in the CSV export, as covered in ["Sharing roadmaps"|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfolioserver/sharing-roadmaps-960719459.html]:
{quote}
This will immediately generate and download a CSV file of the plan’s data, based on the [current filters|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfolioserver/filtering-issues-962968235.html] and [hierarchy range|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfolioserver/viewing-work-960719431.html#Viewingwork-hierarchy-range] applied to the plan.
{quote}
Noting: The Default Filter is set to *Dependencies = all issues* so the filter is being ignored

h3. Actual Results
the dependency data is not included in the export

h3. NOTE:
Take note that the custom field added to the columns is exported but the Dependency data is not

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Exporting plan as CSV does not include Dependencies

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If a Jira user creates a new custom field using the Target Start or Target End field types, these new fields will pull the data already available to the default Target Start/End fields.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a custom field using Target Start, and name it something obvious like "TARGET START 2".
 # Add this new field to the view issue screen of your project so you can see it's value. (None yet.)
 # Go to a Portfolio Plan for the Project that uses this field, change the normal Target Start field for an issue, and commit this back to Jira.
 # !targetStartInPlan.png|width=352,height=153!
 # View that same issue in Jira, and observe the TARGET START 2 fields holds the same data as what you input into the original Target Start field in JPO. 
 # !targetStartNewCustomFieldinIssue.png|width=352,height=199!

h3. Expected Results

This would an entirely separate field with its own stored values.
h3. Actual Results

Any new custom field of the Target Start type gets the data from the original Target Start field.
h3. Workaround

Use a date field instead of the "Target" fields.
fields.summary: Creating a custom field of the "Target Start" or "Target End" type pulls data from the default versions of those fields.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When selecting releases to import into the plan, it is *not* obvious that this will also import issues without a release/fix version applied to them. In some cases, users do not want to import those, and should be allowed to configure the plan to ignore them automatically.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create 2 issues in project, 1 with a release and 1 without
 # Create a plan and only select the release for issue 1.
 # Observe issue 2 has been imported as well.

h3. Expected Results

Just issues with a release would be imported
h3. Actual Results

Selected release is imported along with issues without a release/fix version
h3. Workaround

Use a filter as the issue source to exclude issues without a release.
fields.summary: Create option during issue source configuration where you can choose "Do not import Issues without a release/fix version"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you add a custom field to a plan and use it to filter the issues in that plan, save the view as the filter and then remove the custom field you can no longer load the plan. There is a workaround to resolve this though (see below).
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a plan
 # Add a supported custom field to the plan that supports filtering (e.g. select list)
 # Ensure that filtering is enabled for the custom field
 # Go to the plan view and filter using that custom field
 # Save the view
 # Switch to another view and use the same custom field filter and save this view as well
 # Remove that custom field from the plan
 # Switch back to the previous view with the custom field filter

h3. Expected Results

There should not be any error
h3. Actual Results

Then plan goes blank with an error. JS console will have the following message logged:
{noformat}customField not found for the filter{noformat}
h3. Workaround
 # Edit the URL in the browser bar from swapping #plan/backlog to #settings/customFields
 # Add back the custom field that were removed
 # Make sure to set the custom field so that filtering is enabled
 # Go back to the plan (it should now load)
fields.summary: Removing a custom field that has been used to filter a plan results in not being able to reload the plan

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If a custom field is added to a Portfolio plan, the Portfolio filter will show all options from all contexts configured in the custom field in Jira. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a custom field with multiple contexts and values across contexts.
# Assign different projects to separate contexts.  
# Load only one of the projects in a plan. 

h3. Expected Results
Only the field options in the context applied to the project should be visible. 
Portfolio should identify the projects in plan (just like Agile boards identify projects in board) and only show the options defined in contexts used by those projects. 

h3. Actual Results
All options from all contexts are visible
 
h3. Notes
This occurs because Portfolio doesn't check which projects are in the plan and thus, cannot limit the contexts it shows values from. 

h3.Workaround
No workaround is available.
fields.summary: Filter for custom field values shows all options from all contexts

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Custom HTML is custom field options shows properly in Jira. For example, if admins need to customize text colors. 
* <font color="red">Red</font>
* <font color="yellow">Yellow</font>

When adding such a custom field to a Portfolio plan and using it in a filter. Colors won't be shown. 
The entire HTML text will be visible. 
h3. Suggested Solution
Render the HTML to show the options colored in the Portfolio filter. 
h3. Workaround
None

h3. Note 
This is logged a feature request and not a bug because HTML customization isn't supported in Jira.
fields.summary: Support custom HTML in custom field options when filtering

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
It is possible to add a multi-select custom field to a Portfolio plan but it's not possible to filter for this custom field. 

The checkbox is grayed out. When you hover it, it show: 
{quote}
Filtering for this custom field type is not supported
{quote}

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow Portfolio users to filter for multi-select custom fields.

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Support filtering for multi-select custom fields

fields.description: As a Portfolio admin, it would be helpful to have a specific permission to change the *Target Start* and *Target End* fields' values, similar to the *Schedule issues* permission available in Jira Software.
fields.summary: Permission for altering Target Start and Target End fields.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*.
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
The ability to share a plan link in Confluence's *Portfolio for Jira plan* macro that shows a Portfolio plan at the program level. This would allow admin to rollup data from the contained plans to display. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement feature.
fields.summary: Generate link that allows Confluence's *Portfolio for Jira plan* macro that shows a Portfolio plan at the program level.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Having a large number of releases (>500) causes plan performance, especially on load, to drop dramatically.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have over 500 releases in a plan

h3. Expected Results

Performance is not affected, plan loads at normal speed
h3. Actual Results

Actual Results
 Performance can drop quite dramatically as the number of releases grows past 500.

Cases seen:

~500 releases - 1 minute loading time for plan

~700 releases - 2 minute loading time for plan

~5000 releases - 10 minute loading tie for plan
h3. Workaround
 # Go to the *Plan settings > Issue sources > Edit issue sources*. Then in the wizard - step 2, unselect the {color:#00875a}*COMPLETED*{color} releases. 
 # Go to the *Plan settings > Issue sources > Edit issue sources*. Then in the wizard - step 1, select *Filter* and select a filter where the completed releases are excluded.
fields.summary: Having a large number of releases causes performance of a plan to become slow

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In the documentation, there is no explicit mention of issues that would be listed in Plan's issue sources are only the unresolved issues. 

h3. Suggested Solution
To have the documentation https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfolioserver/issue-sources-967895168.html to explicitly mention what issues would be and would not be listed.
For example:
* All unresolved issues would be listed, however, 
* All unresolved issues would not be listed in issue sources.
fields.summary: Explicit mention of what issues would be listed in Plan's issue sources

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Some issues go randomly missing from the Portfolio plan. The plan shows uncommitted changes but on the opening 'Review and Commit Changes' dialog, no pending commits are shown. The problem is caused due to uncommitted and invisible issues blocking each other
 !image-2020-04-01-20-36-04-201.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
NA

h3. Expected Results
All the issues should be visible in the plan and changes can be committed successfully.

h3. Actual Results
Some issues are missing from the plan and uncommitted changes could not be committed.

h3. Workaround
Basically, the stuck/pending uncommitted issues prevent them to be loaded and therefore can't be reverted via `Uncommitted changes` dialog. As a workaround, we would need to clean up the uncommitted changes using the 'Scenarios Manager' using below steps:
1. Open Scenarios Manager via Configure -> Scenarios
2. Enable scenarios and create an Initial scenario. Uncommitted changes will automatically be assigned to this scenario
3. Now click on 'Create Scenario' to create a new one using the `Blank scenario` option.
4. Delete the initial one.
5. Disable scenarios.
fields.summary: Issues go missing from the plan and the plan shows uncommitted changes that do not appear in the 'Review and Commit Changes' dialog.

fields.description:
Currently, all plans created in Portfolio are by default browsable to everyone who has Portfolio access. This creates a problem with multi-tenant instances, where portfolio users should only view plans they are allowed to view, and don't have any access to other plans. Such users are able to see plan names, and this can give away sensitive information such as client names to them.

The problem will be sorted if we allow specifying default plan permissions, rather than trying to educate all users to lock down every single plan after creation.
fields.summary: Allow specifying default plan permissions in Portfolio

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Boards with Portfolio fields added in the card layout loads slow. Removing the Portfolio fields make it load way faster. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a board with more than 50 issues 
# Ensure that these issues have values in Portfolio fields such as Target start/end dates and Parent Link. 
# Go to the Board > Configure > Card layout 
# Add Portfolio fields in both active sprint and backlog
# Go back to the board and notice the change in the loading time.

h3. Expected Results
Board still loads the same. No slowness. 

h3. Actual Results
Board loads significantly slow. In the HAR file with Portfolio fields, {{/rest/greenhopper/1.0/xboard/plan/backlog/data.json}} went up from 150ms (without Portfolio fields) to 4+ seconds. 



h3. Workaround
Remove the Portfolio fields in the card layout.
fields.summary: Including Portfolio fields in the Board's card layout makes the Board load slow

fields.description:
Currently on Portfolio Plans > Release tab, only *issue count* is available as Progress metric for the Releases:
 !image-2020-03-16-17-50-20-900.png|thumbnail! 

The request is to make other metrics available for Progress calculation:

 - History Points
 - Time (days or hours)
fields.summary: Allow Story Points and Time as calculation Metrics for Releases

fields.description:
Hi,

we are integrating Portfolio and we would like to have application events for the whole team planning process.

In our case this would mean to add events for the following cases:
 * add / remove / change a team
 * add / remove / change a resource
 * add / remove / change a person
 * add / remove / change an exception

This is important to keep our planning in sync with Jira Portfolio
fields.summary: Provide application events like issue change events for shared team operations
Sharing an iframe to embed a Program ships the incorrect JSPA file

fields.description:
h4. Problem
The filter search in a plan's Issue Sources is not as robust as some other areas of Jira. 

For instance
* Each word is treated as "OR". This means that if your filter has a common word in it (in the example below, "for") then the search will bring back many filters. If there are many filters in the system, this can make it impossible to locate the desired filter. Essentially, the input does not do a whole text search. 
* Unable to search for filter by filter id

These characteristics make searching for filters difficult on larger instances with many filters. The problem is worse when a word that is common and shared amongst many filters. 


h3. Example:
Searching for the string "for SCRU", we would expect the two filters "Filter for SCRUM" and "Filter for SCRU" to be returned. 

In Agile boards we see:
 !Screen Shot 2020-02-20 at 3.46.11 pm.png|thumbnail! 

In Portfolio we see:
 !Screen Shot 2020-02-20 at 3.46.40 pm.png|thumbnail! 

h4. Suggested Solution
The problems above could be mitigated by implementing a filter search similar to what is provided in Agile Boards. 

The agile board filter searches whole strings (doesn't "OR" on spaces), highlights the result as it is typed. 

h4. Workaround
There is no full workaround currently available. 

However, wrapping the search term in double quotation marks ("") will perform an AND search, but it will only if each word matches exactly. (IE: in the examples above, the search "for SCRU" would only return "Filter for SCRU" not "Filter for SCRUM"
fields.summary: Improve Issue Source filter search for instances with many filters

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When using the [redesigned planning interface|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfolioserver0318/creating-releases-986881160.html], if users create a cross-project release, Jira does not automatically create a project release on each project involved.

This was different when using the [old interface|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfolioserver0318/creating-releases-986881160.html]. Whenever users created a cross-project release, it would automatically create releases on each related project, after committing the changes on Jira Portfolio

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow users to configure this behavior when using the redesigned interface. Users might want to have the versions automatically created, instead of creating releases and linking them at the cross-project release creating
 
h3. Workaround 
Use the  [old plan interface|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfolioserver0318/creating-releases-986881160.html]
fields.summary: Allow users to automatically create releases on each project when creating cross-project releases

 # Selecting the option based on *_+Initiative 1+_*, then *Epic 1* and *Epic 2* will be selected. However, those child issues under Epic 1 and Epic 2 is not included.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Following a full (foreground) Jira reindex, JQL queries that involve Portfolio custom field values return incorrect results. Boards that are based on such queries also suffer from the same problem.

This custom fields affected are:

* A subtask’s parent’s Team
* An issue's Target Start and Target End dates
* An issue's Original Story Points

h4. Versions Affected

Jira >= 8.1 _and_ Portfolio >= 3.18

The problem was introduced when adding support for archived issues. This support was added in Jira 8.1 and Portfolio 3.18. You must be running these (or subsequent) versions of both Jira _and_ Portfolio for this problem to surface.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 
# In Jira admin, run a full index (not a background index)
# Run a JQL query that includes a subquery for a custom field value

The subquery can be {{IS EMPTY}}, {{IS NOT EMPTY}}, {{= <specific value>}}

h3. Expected Results

The issues found should include/exclude issues according to the sub-query.

For example, {{Team = <Team Name>}} should include all issues assigned to the nominated team _and_ their sub-tasks. 

Boards based on such queries should correctly include/exclude issues.

h3. Actual Results

The issues found do not take into account the sub-query.

For example, sub-tasks whose parent issue is assigned to the team are excluded.

Boards based on such queries incorrectly include/exclude issues.

h3. Workaround

If you are not in a position to upgrade to JPOS 3.21, a background index typically resolves the issue, ie. the custom field values are correctly indexed in this case.

Once you have upgraded to JPOS 3.21, a re-index will be necessary to correct the incomplete index. This can be done using either a full or background index.
fields.summary: A full Jira index does not index Portfolio's custom field values that are stored as entity properties resulting in incorrect JQL query results

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The auto-schedule does not plan sprints scope in the correct way. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Setup your board as follows:
 # Create *3 sprints* in your board
 ## *Do not start* any of these sprints.
 ## *Do not put* any issues in these sprints - *leave them all empty*.
 ## Add *10 stories* of type *Story* and status *TODO* in the backlog of issues.
 ## Do the following actions on the stories:
 ### *Story 1*: put an estimate of *10* story points
 ### *Story 2*: put an estimate of *3* story points
 ### *Story 3*: put an estimate of *4* story points
 ### *Story 4*: put an estimate of *15* story points
 ### *Story 5*: put an estimate of *13* story points
 ### *Story 6*:
 #### Do not put any estimates on the story
 #### Create one sub-task and put an estimate of *3* story points
 ### *Story 7*: put an estimate of *3* story points
 ### *Story 8*: 
 #### Do not put any estimates on the story
 #### Create two sub-tasks:
 ##### Put an estimate of *5* story points on the first sub-task
 ##### Put an estimate of *15* story points on the second sub-task
 ### *Story 9*: put an estimate of *20* story points
 ### *Story 10*: put an estimate of *4* story points
 # Create a new plan in Portfolio and select the board as the issue source.
 # Once the plan is created, load the roadmap page, then click on *View settings* and select *Group by > Sprint*.
 # You should now see all your issues grouped in one *Unassigned* sprint.
 # Make sure that the following fields are displayed
 ## Target start date
 ## Target end date
 ## Status
 ## Story points
 # Click on the *Teams* tab.
 # Make sure that there is only one team created with the following settings:
 ## Team type: *Scrum*
 ## Velocity: *30* (pts)
 ## Iteration length: *2* (weeks)
 # Click on the *Roadmap* tab.
 # Click on *Auto-schedule*.
 # In the *Auto-schedule* dialog window, select *All values* for *Sprints*, *Releases*, and *Teams*.
 # Click on *Preview results*
 # The preview results page should be displayed.
 # 

h3. Expected Results

All sprints should include as many stories as possible as long as there is still enough capacity for the team to complete them.
h3. Actual Results

As illustrated in the *004-auto-schedule-preview.png* screenshot:
 * In *Sprint 1:*
 ** There are *4 stories*
 ** There are 10 + 3 + 4 + 13 = *30 story points* 
 * In *Sprint 2:*
 ** There are *4 stories* and *1 sub-task*
 ** There are 15 + 3 + 3 + 4 = *25 story points* i
 * In *Sprint 3:*
 * There are *1 story* and *2 sub-tasks*
 * There are 5 + 15 = *20 story points* 

The Auto schedule should have put the sub-task with *5 story points* into *Sprint 2* as there was still enough capacity to tackle it (*25 / 30 story points*)
h3. Workaround

When using a team composed of virtual users instead of non-virtual users, the auto-schedule seems to plan sprints scope in a correct way.
fields.summary: Auto-Schedule is not planning sprints scope in a correct way

fields.description:
h3. Background
When searching for Parent Link, Jira/JPO searches for the CONCEPT or Parent Link, considering _"Parent Link" is not EMPTY_:
* Issues (subtasks) with parent issues
* Issues with Epics
* Issues with Parent Links (the JPO custom field itself)

 !image-2020-02-05-10-55-20-924.png|thumbnail! 


h3. The issue
If instead of the _is not EMPTY_ clause we specify an Issue as Parent Link, Jira/JPO fails to consider the subtasks's parents as it had previously on the _is not EMPTY_ search:
 !image-2020-02-05-10-58-51-125.png|thumbnail! 
It should have brought 2 issues whose Epic is K1-7 and the K1-10 which is a subtask of K1-7.
fields.summary: Searching for a specific Parent Link issue doesn't consider it's subtasks

fields.description:
h3. Current behavior

Searching for_ Parent Link _actually searches for the CONCEPT of Parent Link, meaning it considers all three possible links:
 * Issues (subtasks) with parent issues
 * Issues with Epics
 * Issues with Parent Links (the JPO custom field itself)

h3. The issue

_Parent Link_ is the name of a Portfolio for Jira (JPO) custom field.
 _Parent Link_ is also a searchable field in JQL, but it behaves differently than just searching for the _Parent Link custom field_, leading many users to confusion and the impression that Parent Link JQL does not work with EMPTY keyword (JPOSERVER-2477).

So if you'd want to search for issues with only the _Parent Link_ custom field, you'd have to exclude the other 2 possible link types:
{code:java}
"Parent Link" is not EMPTY AND "Epic Link" is EMPTY AND issuetype in standardIssueTypes()
{code}
h3. The ask

Make it so — somehow — that the abstraction of _Parent Link_ search doesn't conflict with the _Parent Link custom field_.
fields.summary: Change the "Parent Link" search keyword so it doesn't conflict with the "Parent Link" custom field

fields.description:
*Problem:*

We are having a problem creating issues in Portfolio.

When we commit, we are prompted with a required fields screen. The issue type field appears to be disabled (it is greyed out). Users assume that they cannot change the issue type there and forge ahead. 

 

*Use Case:*

The main use case is actually on issues above Epic. Portfolio Hierarchy starts with Initiative at the top. Two issue types (Architectural Epic and Business Epic) are below Initiative. Then we have Epic, then Story.

When users are creating issues, they are not changing the Issue type to the correct one, as they think they can not change it.

 

 

*Usability issue:*

The usage of grey color is incorrect. The field is not actually disabled. It can be changed.

It would save the users a lot of time and aggravation if you could display it as enabled.
fields.summary: As a user we would like that the issue type field was not greyed out at the required fields screen

fields.description:
As a PgM, I want to plan capacity based on individual assignee capacity. 

h2.Expected Results
Auto-schedule incorporates both individual (i.e., issue assignee) capacity as well as team capacity within its calculations and scheduling of issues.

h2.Actual Results
Roadmap view currently (as of JPO 3.19.x) displays issue assignees (as its own column), yet the Auto-Schedule feature does not incorporate issue assignee data into its algorithm.

From usability perspective this is confusing, as a PM might expect the Assignee column to be a factor in the Gantt chart scheduling.

h2.Notes

This is functionality that was built into Microsoft Project's planning feature set.

Please see related documentation:

* [Auto\-scheduling issues|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfolioserver/auto-scheduling-issues-967895245.html]
* [Understanding team capacity|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfolioserver/understanding-team-capacity-974360319.html]
fields.summary: Plan auto-schedules based on individual assignee capacity in addition to team capacity

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

It is not possible to upgrade to and use Portfolio for Jira Server 3.19.0 if you have visiting plans on 3.12.0. This problem is the result of a change in a database table schema. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have a Portfolio for Jira Server version 3.12.0 running on a Jira instance
 # Create and visit some plans
 # (optional) upgrade to any version of Portfolio up to and including 3.18.1 (viewing plans should continue to work)
 # Attempt to upgrade to Portfolio 3.19.0
 # Attempt to view a plan

h3. Expected Results

You should be able to access plans
h3. Actual Results

Plan fails to load. The following error message is displayed in the logs
{noformat}
ALTER TABLE only allows columns to be added that can contain nulls, or have a DEFAULT definition specified, or the column being added is an identity or timestamp column, or if none of the previous conditions are satisfied the table must be empty to allow addition of this column. Column 'C_KEY' cannot be added to non-empty table 'AO_D9132D_SAVED_VIEW' because it does not satisfy these conditions.
{noformat}
h3. Workaround
 * Downgrade to Portfolio 3.18.1 or earlier
 * Upgrade to fix version Portfolio 3.19.1 or later
fields.summary: Upgrading to 3.19.0 after visiting plans on version 3.12.0 prevents you from accessing plans

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When dragging and dropping a parent issue in the Portfolio 3.0 improved interface will only impact the rank for the issue you moved. The rank for all descendent issues will remain unchanged.

This behaviour used to be the default behaviour in 2.0 but was changed due to feedback (more info: JPOSERVER-2493

*Allow the user to configure between the old ranking behaviour and the new ranking behaviour*
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Drag an epic (with children) from the bottom of the plan to the top

h3. Expected Results
 * The child issues of the epic would be ranked to the top when viewing story <-> story.
 * Auto-schedule would consider the child issues as high-priority.

h3. Actual Results
 * All child issues would also be ranked to the top - looking at only the story level issues, the child issues will remain ranked at the bottom
 * Auto-schedule considers these issues last.

h3. Workaround
 # Select the issue and all it's children
 # Select Bulk actions
 # Bulk change 'Rank'
 # Set the new rank for all selected issues in the hierarchy
fields.summary: Ability to change the rank of an issue resulting in all descendents of the issue to also be ranked

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you update/edit a sub-task while the Teams field is added to the edit issue screen, the system will remove the inherited team from the sub task, BUT will leave the Team within the UI. If you then reindex the instance, when you search by Team in the UI, the sub-tasks do not appear even though the Team remains in the UI of the issue. This does take a specific series of steps described below.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create Parent and sub task within a JPO Plan
 # Create Shared Team
 # Add Shared Team to Parent issue (sub-task will inherit it)
 # Within issue source/project, add Teams field to the edit issue screen
 # Edit the sub-task, make no changes, and click update
 # Observe issue history showing Team field has changed from selected Team to Empty
 # Full Lock and Reindex the instance
 # Search for issues by Team
 # Observe Sub-task that was updated does not appear, but keeps the Team in the Teams field of the Issue View

h3. Expected Results

Updating a sub-task with the Team field exposed would not change the inherited Team.
h3. Actual Results

Sub-task will retain the value in the Teams field, but appears to be out of sync with the index. This causes the sub-tasks to not appear in searches or in Boards that filter by Team Id.
h3. Workaround

Remove Team field from edit issue screen.

*NOTES: Further testing appears to show that this can occur even when the field is not exposed on the edit issue screen. You can cause this just by updating the issue when the Team field appears on the issue view screen.*
fields.summary: Updating a sub-task from the edit screen with the JPO Teams field exposed and inherited from Parent removes the Team

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Performing a JQL search using "Target end" or "Target start" dates returns 0 or incorrect results. For example:  'project = "Project name" AND "Target end" is EMPTY' returns data with Target end having actual date not EMPTY. The same for NULL.

Another example JQL that will break: 'project = ABCD AND "Target End" >= '2020-01-01' AND "Target End" < '2020-03-01''
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a project and some issues
 # Create a Jira Portfolio plan using the new project
 # Update some issues in the plan with a "Target end" or "Target start" date
 # Perform the JQL search 'project = "Project name " AND "Target end" is EMPTY' or 'project = Blah AND "Target start" >= '2020-01-01''
 # Note the results return as expected. 
 # Complete a Full reindex. 
 # Repeat the same JQL searches. 

h3. Expected Results

Return only issues with Target end where it's empty or returns the issues that meet that the JQL parameters. Note: Before the reindex, expected results are found. After the reindex they are not. 
h3. Actual Results

It returns all data for both empty Target end date and non-empty.
h3. Workaround

A background index will temporary remediate the issue. No permanent solution has been found.
fields.summary: JQL searches using "Target end" or "Target Start" dates return 0 or incorrect results

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Creating a release with start date "Relative to previous release date" and starting before causes scope to have duplicate issues
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to release tab
 # Create a release
 # Select "Relative to previous release date" for start date
 # Set the start date to 4 weeks before previous release
 # Set end date to "After all issues are completed"
 # Go back to roadmap tab

h3. Expected Results

Release is created
h3. Actual Results

The scope now seems to have duplicated all the issues
h3. Workaround

Null
fields.summary: Creating a release with start date "Relative to previous release date" and starting before causes scope to have duplicate issues
Permission pages shows incorrect behaviour for Restricted User

fields.description:
h3. Definition/Scenario

I set the next release's start date to *Relative to previous release date (1 week after)*. Now, all the issues in the previous release are already set to _Done_ and the progress bar is completed. The Release has been released from Jira's side and the release date has been set as well. However, going back to the Plan, I am expecting that the next release will have the start date value auto-populated but it's not happening. I also tried to auto-schedule it from the Roadmap view but nothing happened. 

According to one of the Portfolio devs, it is not working currently but this is something that is being looked at for future improvement thus, created this feature request. 

h3. Suggestion
Auto-populate the next release's start date once the previous release has been released.
fields.summary: Relative to previous release date does not Auto-populate dates

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

In [Plans comparison|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfolioserver0227/plans-comparison-968668531.html] for *Track* section of "View original estimates", Live plans include the display of Original estimates column starting Portfolio for Jira 2.2.0 as per https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1365

h3. Suggested Solution

Update the [Plans comparison|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfolioserver0227/plans-comparison-968668531.html] to show that "View original estimates" is possible in Live plans.
fields.summary: Fix the incorrect details in "Plan Comparison" page

fields.description:
*Issue Summary*
 While both filter and group-by options are applied for the *Team* field, no issues are displayed.

*Environment*
 Portfolio 3.18

*Steps to Reproduce*
 # Select a team in the project filter.
 # Now in the view settings, select group by teams

*Expected Results*
 Issues should be grouped by teams.

*Actual Results*
 Shows an empty list of issues.

*Workaround*
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Group by Team while Team filter is applied shows empty list of issues
